name: Murch
cooked: Hey, thanks for sharing your idea. It seems to me that implementing this would suffer from the same problem that you mention in your motivation: we would need to write out all UTXO data and additionally all inputs’ outpoints. It’s not clear to me why you would expect this to reduce the I/O compared to the Bitcoin Core’s current approach. Compared to SwiftSync which uses the hints to compress the checking of all spent UTXOs to a single accumulator (which can also be parallelized), this feels like a regression. Perhaps I’m overlooking something. Could you clarify what the novel contribution here is?

Compared to SwiftSync which uses the hints to compress the checking of all spent UTXOs to a single accumulator (which can also be parallelized), this feels like a regression.
Perhaps I’m overlooking something. Could you clarify what the novel contribution here is?
